title: ISic003551. An antiquarian 'forgery'
body:
1ἰδίῳ · <τέκνῳ> [...]
2ἐποίησεν [...]
3μάτηρ [...]

l.1 τέκνῳ

1ΙΔΙΩ·ΤΕΧΝΗ[···]
2ΕΠΟΙΗΣΕΝ[···]
3ΜΑΤΗΡ[···]

l.1 τέκνῳ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after comparison of Kaibel, Filippi and SEG, prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition

translation

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV.

bibliography

    14.0018* https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072 52.0896 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796 Filippi 2002 74 no.2/10 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001991 Filippi 2005 64 no. 2/10 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296 Korhonen 2017 198 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
